item.title: Max Determinant
item.description: The sequence A181983(n) gives the determinants of the square matrices: \(M_{n}\), with elements \(m_{i,j}= \max(i,j)\), where \(\max\) the is the maximum function. This identity looks as follows: \[ det{\bigg[ max(i,j) \bigg] }_{1\leq i,j \leq n} = -n \cdot {(-1)}^{n} = A181983(n) \] ## Proof A new matrix with the same determinant can be created, subtracting row i from row i+1 starting at the 2nd row, and then this determinant can be computed easily using the expansion by minors technique at element \(m_{1,n}\)
